intro: Plexaure crassiuscula, commonly known as the thick-stemmed sea holly, is a marine flowering plant found in shallow coastal waters. It belongs to the family Crambe, characterized by its unique morphology and adaptations to tidal environments. The plant has fleshy, succulent stems and leaves that help retain moisture in saline conditions. Its flowers are typically small and inconspicuous, often arranged in dense clusters. It plays an important ecological role in stabilizing sediment and providing habitat for marine organisms.
